Class Book

java.lang.Object
  Book

public class Book
extends java.lang.Object

The Book class is to help staff keep track of store inventory.

Version:
May 7, 2007
Author:
Steffen L. Norgren, A00683006

Constructor Summary
Book(java.lang.String bookTitle, java.lang.String bookAuthor, java.lang.String bookPublisher, int bookPublishYear, double bookPurchasePrice)
          The Book constructor allows for the input parameters of title, author, publisher, year published and purchase price.
 
Method Summary
 java.lang.String getAuthor()
          Getter for the book's author
 java.lang.String getPublisher()
          Getter for the book's publisher

          Getter for the book's publish year

          Getter for the book's purchase price

          Getter for the book's quantity in stock
 int getQuantityOnOrder()
          Getter for the book's quantity on order
 int getQuantitySold()
          Getter for the book's quantity sold
 double getSalePrice()
          Getter for the book's sale price
 java.lang.String getTitle()
          Getter for the book's title
 void printDetails()
          This method displays book information on the screen.
 void restock(int restockAmount)
          This mutator method takes a parameter, restockAmount, that specifies the number of books to add to inventory, and increases quantity in stock by that number.
 void sell(int sellAmount)
          This mutator method reduces quantity in stock by the number of books passed in through its parameter, sellAmount.
 void setPurchasePrice(double newPurchasePrice)
          This mutator method accepts the new purchase price as its parameter and changes the appropriate instance variable.
 void setQuantityOnOrder(int newQuantityOnOrder)
          This mutator method passes in the quantity to order as a parameter and adds that value to the current quantity on order.
 void setSellingPrice(double newSalePrice)
          This mutator method accepts the new selling price as its parameter and changes the appropriate instance variable.

clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait
 

Constructor Detail

Book

public Book(java.lang.String bookTitle,
            java.lang.String bookAuthor,
            java.lang.String bookPublisher,
            int bookPublishYear,
            double bookPurchasePrice)
The Book constructor allows for the input parameters of title, author, publisher, year published and purchase price. Quantity in stock and the selling price will be initialized to zero.

public void restock(int restockAmount)
This mutator method takes a parameter, restockAmount, that specifies the number of books to add to inventory, and increases quantity in stock by that number.
